COMMENT_STRING.TEXT: G118R is an uncommon HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has not yet been reported in HIV-2 infected patients.
F121Y is an uncommon HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has not yet been reported in HIV-2 infected patients.
G140S is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1 associated drug-resistance mutation which is also selected by INSTIs in HIV-2-infected persons

Y143C/R are non-polymorphic mutations associated with high-level RAL resistance. Alone, they have minimal effects on EVG susceptibility. However, they are associated with intermediate to high-level reductions in EVG susceptibility when they occur in combination with one or more accessory INSTI-resistance mutations. Y143 mutations do not reduce DTG or BIC susceptibility.
S147G is a non-polymorphic HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation that has also been reported in INSTI-experienced persons.
Q148H/K/R are nonpolymorphic HIV-1 associated drug-resistance mutation which are also selected by INSTIs in HIV-2-infected persons
S153YF are extremely rare nonpolymorphic HIV-1-associated INSTI-resistance mutations. A153G is a nonpolymorphic HIV-2 mutation that is selected by INSTIs usually in combination with N155H
N155H is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1 associated drug-resistance mutation which is also commonly selected by INSTIs in HIV-2-infected persons
Among HIV-2 isolates, amino acid insertions at position 231 are selected by INSTIs and associated with markedly reduced INSTI susceptibility.
R263K is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has also been reported in HIV-2 infected INSTI-experienced persons.
H51Y is an uncommon HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has also been selected by INSTIs in HIV-2 infected patients.
T66AIK are HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which have not been reported in HIV-2 infected patients.
I84V is a polymorphic HIV-2 associated mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in INSTI-experienced compared with INSTI-naïve persons.
E92Q is an HIV-1-associated drug resistance mutations which is also commonly selected by INSTIs in HIV-2 infected persons. E92G/A have also been reported in INSTI-experienced HIV-2-infected persons
Among HIV-1 isolates, T97A is a minimally polymorphic accessory INSTI-selected mutation. Among HIV-2 isolates, T97A is a nonpolymorphic common INSTI-selected mutation.
V10I is a minimally polymorphic mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
L23I is an uncommon non-polymorphic HIV-1 associated PI-resistance mutation.
D30N is a non-polymorphic mutation that causes high-level HIV-1 resistance to NFV.
V33I is a minimally polymorphic mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
K45R is a minimally polymorphic mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
V47A is a non-polymorphic common PI-selected mutation that reduces HIV-2 susceptibility to LPV and other PIs.
G48VA are non-polymorphic PI-selected HIV-2 mutations
I50L is a non-polymorphic HIV-2 mutation selected by ATV. It causes high-level resistance to ATV and increases susceptibility to most of the remaining PIs.
I50V is a non-polymorphic PI-selected mutation that reduces HIV-2 susceptibility to LPV and other PIs.
F53Y is a nonpolymorphic PI-selected HIV-2 mutation
I54L is a nonpolymorphic PI-selected mutation.
I54M is a non-polymorphic common PI-selected mutation.
T56V is a common nonpolymrophic mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 isolates from PI-treated vs. PI-naïve isolates.
V71I is a common polymorphic mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
A73G is a nonpolymorphic mutation that occurs significantly more commonoly in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
I82F is a non-polymorphic common PI-selected mutations that reduces HIV-2 susceptibility to LPV and other PIs.
I82LM are nonpolymorphic PI-selected HIV-2 mutations.
I84V is a non-polymorphic PI-selected HIV-2 mutation.
I85V is a non-polymorphic PI-selected mutation. It has minimal, if any, effects on PI susceptibility.
N88D is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1-associated PI resistance mutation that has been reported in one PI-treated HIV-2 isolate.
L90M is a non-polymorphic PI-selected HIV-2 mutation.
M95V is a nonpolymorphic mutations that occurs significantly more common in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
L99F is a nonpolymorphic mutations that occurs significantly more common in PI-treated than PI-naïve HIV-2 isolates.
V111I is a common polymorphic mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons.
Y11F is associated with reduced susceptibility to each of the NRTIs
F116Y is an accessory HIV-1-associated mutation that usually occurs in combination with the multi-NRTI resistance mutation Q151M. It has not been associated with NRTI therapy in HIV-2 isolates.
Q151M causes high-level resistance to each of the NRTIs.

M184V/I cause high-level in vitro resistance to 3TC and FTC and low-level resistance to ABC. However, M184V/I are not contraindications to continued treatment with 3TC or FTC because they increase susceptibility to AZT, TDF and d4T and are associated with clinically significant reductions in HIV-1 replication.
D195N is a slighly polymorphic HIV-2 mutation that occurs with increased frequency in NRTI-treated persons.
210W is an HIV-1 associated TAM. The HIV-2 consensus at this position is N. Mutations at this position have not been selected by NRTIs in HIV-2 isolates.
F214L is a slighly polymorphic HIV-2 mutation that occurs with increased frequency in NRTI-treated persons.
S215Y/F occur significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons but their effects on HIV-2 susceptibility to NRTIs is uncertain.
219QENR are HIV-1 associated TAMs. The HIV-2 consensus at this position is E. Mutations at this position have not been selected by NRTIs in HIV-2 isolates.
K40R occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons.
M41L is an HIV-1 associated TAM that has not been selected by NRTIs in HIV-2-infected persons and has not been associated with reduced HIV-2 susceptibility to NRTIs.
A62V occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons.

K65R occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons and is associated with reduced susceptibility to XXX.K65N/E are mutations that have rarely been selected by TDF, ABC, and d4T in HIV-1 isolates.
K65R occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons and is associated with reduced susceptibility to XXX.
D67 mutations are commonly occurring HIV-1-assocated TAMs that are not selected in HIV-2 isolates.
Deletions in the Beta3-Beta4 loop are associated with reduced HIV-1 susceptibility to each of the NRTIs but they have not been reported in HIV-2 isolates.
N69S is a slighly polymorphic HIV-2 mutation that occurs with increased frequency in NRTI-treated persons.
Insertions in the Beta3-Beta4 loop are associated with reduced HIV-1 susceptibility to each of the NRTIs but they have not been reported in HIV-2 isolates.
K70N occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons but its effects on HIV-2 susceptibility to NRTIs is uncertain.
K70R occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons but its effects on HIV-2 susceptibility to NRTIs is uncertain.
L74VI are common HIV-1-associated NRTI-resistance mutations that have not been reported in HIV-2 sequences.
I75V occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons but its effects on HIV-2 susceptibility to NRTIs is uncertain.
F77L is an accessory HIV-1-associated mutation that usually occurs in combination with the multi-NRTI resistance mutation Q151M. It has not been associated with NRTI therapy in HIV-2 isolates.
G118R is an uncommon HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has not yet been reported in HIV-2 infected patients.
F121Y is an uncommon HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has not yet been reported in HIV-2 infected patients.
G140S is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1 associated drug-resistance mutation which is also selected by INSTIs in HIV-2-infected persons

Y143C/R are non-polymorphic mutations associated with high-level RAL resistance. Alone, they have minimal effects on EVG susceptibility. However, they are associated with intermediate to high-level reductions in EVG susceptibility when they occur in combination with one or more accessory INSTI-resistance mutations. Y143 mutations do not reduce DTG or BIC susceptibility.

Q148H/K/R are nonpolymorphic HIV-1 associated drug-resistance mutation which are also selected by INSTIs in HIV-2-infected persons

N155H is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1 associated drug-resistance mutation which is also commonly selected by INSTIs in HIV-2-infected persons
Among HIV-2 isolates, amino acid insertions at position 231 are selected by INSTIs and associated with markedly reduced INSTI susceptibility.
R263K is a nonpolymorphic HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has also been reported in HIV-2 infected INSTI-experienced persons.
H51Y is an uncommon HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which has also been selected by INSTIs in HIV-2 infected patients.
T66AIK are HIV-1-associated drug-resistance mutation which have not been reported in HIV-2 infected patients.
I84V is a polymorphic HIV-2 associated mutation that occurs significantly more commonly in INSTI-experienced compared with INSTI-naïve persons.
E92Q is an HIV-1-associated drug resistance mutations which is also commonly selected by INSTIs in HIV-2 infected persons. E92G/A have also been reported in INSTI-experienced HIV-2-infected persons

K40R occurs significantly more commonly in HIV-2 sequences from NRTI-treated than NRTI-naïve persons.
